name: Tun Keltesch
title: Software Engineer
description: I build robust, user-friendly, and visually appealing web solutions, with a passion for continuous technical innovation.
about: In the past 5 years, I embarked on my journey as a tech enthusiast, diving deep into the world of coding and web development. Fast-forward to today, and I've had the incredible opportunity to work on a wide range of projects, from building and maintaining websites to capturing stunning aerial footage with drone technology.

Currently, I am a Junior Project Engineer at Hexagon in Vienna, Austria, where I continue to tackle new challenges and expand my expertise. I am passionate about creating unique perspectives and combining my technical skills with creativity.
I speak Luxemburgish, French, German, English, and some Portuguese, which helps me connect with a diverse range of clients and colleagues.
Contact me, and let's see how we can create something amazing together!

experience.description: As a Junior Project Engineer at Hexagon in Vienna, Austria, I support the planning, implementation, and management of engineering projects.
Developed and maintained a Shopify website and contributed to the new version of Dyve GmbH's website, working flexibly from 8 to 30 hours a week based on project needs.

Developed an attack tree visualization tool for the Frauenhofer Institut using Angular, TypeScript, and D3.js. Built AI chatbots, improved websites, and handled frontend/backend tasks for multiple projects.

experience.company: Chair of Embedded Software at RWTH Aachen University
experience.description: Implemented an OS for an ATmega 644 using C. Gained hands-on experience in low-level programming and embedded systems development.

Provided first-level support to private clients and extended support to business clients, handling internet connectivity issues. Tested and provided feedback on internal tools, enhancing knowledge of web technologies and frontend development.

certificates.description: Completed seven courses that cover the entire UX design process, including empathizing with users, defining pain points, ideating design solutions, creating wireframes and prototypes, and testing designs for feedback.

certificates.jobTitle: Specialization Certificate - Google IT Automation with Python
certificates.description: Completed multiple courses including Crash Course on Python, Troubleshooting and Debugging Techniques, Introduction to Git and GitHub, Configuration Management and the Cloud. Gained skills in automating tasks with Python, using Git and GitHub for version control, managing IT resources at scale, and analyzing real-world IT problems to implement appropriate solutions.

education.description: Advanced level in Economics and Mathematics

projects.title: SwiftDrones Website
projects.description: A website for a drone company.
big_description: The SwiftDrones Website project involved creating a comprehensive online presence for SwiftDrones, a company specializing in drone technology and services.

Our team of drone enthusiasts, based in Luxembourg, is dedicated to providing clients with high-quality imagery for various applications. We leverage cutting-edge drone technology to deliver compelling visual content that meets the unique requirements of each client.
The website is built with React and styled using TailwindCSS. We utilize Google Cloud to host our images and videos, ensuring high availability and performance.
This project is a labor of love, reflecting our passion for drones and our commitment to excellence in aerial photography and videography.

projects.title: CanvasCraft
projects.description: AI image generation tool, with accurate color palette and style transfer.
big_description: CanvasCraft is an AI-powered image generation tool designed to create stunning visuals. By leveraging OpenAI's DALL-E 3, CanvasCraft transforms text prompts into detailed images, accurately replicating color palettes and applying various art styles.

Users start by entering simple information. Through the help of GPT, the system refines this initial input by internally communicating with itself, ensuring a highly precise and detailed prompt is constructed. This refined prompt is then sent to DALL-E 3 to generate the final image.

The backend, built with Python and Flask, implements OpenAI's API to ensure high-quality image outputs. Users can specify color palettes, themes, moods, and custom prompts to guide the image generation process.

On the frontend, CanvasCraft utilizes React and TailwindCSS to provide an intuitive user interface. The application offers a range of options for users to select their desired artistic elements and see their visions come to life.

projects.title: Text2UML
projects.description: VSCode extension for bidirectional navigation and conversion of text to UML diagrams
big_description: Text2UML is a VSCode extension that allows users to convert text descriptions into UML diagrams and navigate between the text and diagram representations.
Users can create UML diagrams by writing text descriptions of the diagram elements, such as classes, attributes, and relationships.
The extension provides bidirectional navigation between the text and diagram representations, allowing users to easily switch between the two views.

content.description: Text2UML is a VSCode extension that allows users to convert text descriptions into UML diagrams and navigate between the text and diagram representations.
Users can create UML diagrams by writing text descriptions of the diagram elements, such as classes, attributes, and relationships.
The extension provides bidirectional navigation between the text and diagram representations, allowing users to easily switch between the two views.

projects.title: Gemini Competition - Language Learning Platform
projects.description: Personalized language learning through news and generated exercises.
big_description: The language learning platform uses news articles and generated exercises to help users improve their language skills. This is an ongoing project and will likely continue even after the competition deadline of August 12, 2024.
Users can select their target language and proficiency level, and the platform will provide them with news articles in the target language.
The platform generates exercises based on the news articles, such as vocabulary quizzes, grammar exercises, and comprehension questions, to help users practice and improve their language skills.

We use Flutter for the frontend, Google Cloud for infrastructure, Firebase for real-time data and authentication, Google Functions for serverless operations, and Python to communicate with the Gemini API, which is at the core of our language processing and exercise generation.
projects.link_text: Checkout the Gemini API Developer Competition
